collection: The data collection node creates the container for your data. This is the first node to add.
source: With the source node your data is imported to GLAMpipe. The data can be read from a file (xml, csv, tsv or json) or it can be imported from an API.
transform: Transform nodes are used to modify fields in your data. Typical modifications are trimming spaces, splitting values, changing case and so on.
lookup: Lookup nodes can fetch data from other GLAMpipe data collections or from external APIs.
export: Export nodes write files (XML, JSON etc.) or send data to external APIs.
map: Map nodes allow you to format your data usually for export purposes. They can be also used for flattening deep structures.
download: With the download nodes you can dowloads files to the local hard disk from URLs defined in the chosen field.
upload: Upload nodes upload files and data to web services such as Wikidata or Wikimedia Commons.
file: File nodes operate on local files (MD5 sum, thumbnailing and so on).
query: Query nodes execute direct queries to database.
